intro: Stoebe capitata, commonly known as clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Stoebe capitata is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
